meanings.definition: The act of treating a sacred place or object with disrespect or irreverence.
meanings.sent1: The desecration of the temple saddened the community.
meanings.sent2: The desecration of the church was a shocking display of disrespect.
meanings.sent3: The children's playful desecration of the sandcastle was unintentional.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti on the historic building was a desecration of its heritage.
meanings.sent5: The desecration of the cemetery left a lasting impact on the town.

meanings.definition: The act of violating the sanctity of something holy or revered.
meanings.sent1: The desecration of the sacred artifact was a sacrilegious act.
meanings.sent2: The desecration of the ancient shrine was met with outrage.
meanings.sent3: The prankster's desecration of the library book was a misguided joke.
meanings.sent4: The pollution of the river was seen as a desecration of nature.
meanings.sent5: The desecration of the national flag was a symbol of disrespect.
